org.svvrl.goal.gui.action

Class WindowAction<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.swing.AbstractAction
      • org.svvrl.goal.gui.action.WindowAction<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of the output
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.util.EventListener, javax.swing.Action, TabSwitchedListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AboutAction, AbstractNewEditableAction, BuchiRepositoryAction, BuchiStoreAction, CheckUpdateAction, ClearAllRecentFileAction, DebugCoreAction, DebugExceptionAction, DebugUIAction, DisplayGridlinesAction, DisplayGuidelinesAction, EditableAction, ExitAction, FloatableToolbarAction, HelpContentsAction, ImportFromTextAction, NewEditableAction, NewWindowAction, NextWindowAction, OpenAction, OpenAllRecentFileAction, PreferenceAction, PreviousWindowAction, PropertyEditorAction, RecentFilesAction, RedoAction, SnapToGridAction, UndoAction

    public abstract class WindowAction<T>
extends javax.swing.AbstractAction
implements TabSwitchedListener
    This class provides actions in GOAL windows. A window action has no input requirement but may produce some output. The execution of a window action is divided into three stages, namely preProcess(ProgressDialog), execute(ProgressDialog), and postProcess(ProgressDialog). The pre-process preProcess(ProgressDialog) is mainly used to check the validity of the inputs of this action and to configure this action. The main execution execute(ProgressDialog) performs the most heavy work. The post-process postProcess(ProgressDialog) is mainly used to process the output produced in execute(ProgressDialog). During the main execution execute(ProgressDialog) and the post-process postProcess(ProgressDialog), a progress dialog will be displayed. If true is passed to setHideProgressBarAfterExecution(boolean), then the progress dialog is only displayed during the main execution execute(ProgressDialog). Whenever there is an error in executing this action, the error message will be displayed in a dialog. By default, a window action is applicable to all tabs. Override isApplicable(Tab) if this action is only applicable to certain tabs.
    Author:
    Ming-Hsien Tsai
    See Also:
    Serialized Form
